page.title: 14Church Schools of Windsor
page.content: The{Churches}pioneered the setting up of schools in Windsor before there was a{state system of Education. The first properly organised school was the{Royal Free Church of England {School}established in 1705 by public subscription for 40 boys and 30 girls. The Roman Catholics set up a school in 1830 and in 1841 the Congregational Church founded a British School, later taken over by the State. In 1985 Windsor is unique in that it still has a network of Church schools both Anglican and Roman Catholic which provide a{Christian education}from the age of 5 to 18. There are 6{First Schools}for 5 to 9 years, 3{Middle Schools}for 9 to 13 years and one{Upper School;}The {Princess Margaret Royal Free}for 13 to 18 years which has evolved from the Royal Free School of 1705.
